This case having been finally heard on today the court on the same day delivered the
following :-
JUDGMENT

1. Accused persons stands trial for offences punishable under sections 341 and
324 read with Sec. 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

2. The prosecution case in brief is as follows :- Due to the previous enmity
towards CW1 Viswanath ,accused no.1 and2 in furtherance of their common
intention to voluntarily cause hurt to him ,on 3.5.2015 at 22.30 hrs ,accused
no.2 wrongfully restrained him at the western side of Attakulangara-
Pazhavangadi public road .It is alleged that the accused no.1 hit on his left
shoulder ,left chest and back of his head with a helmet in multiple times. Thus
the accused no.1 and 2 were committed offences punishable under sections
341 and 324 read with Sec. 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

3. Final report was filed by the Sub Inspector of police, Fort police station before
the Hon'ble Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-[[, Thiruvananthapuram and

3 of 6
the case was taken on file as C.C.1480/2015. Cognizance was taken for the
offences punishable wu/ss. 341 and 324 read with Sec. 34 of Indian Penal Code,
1860 against the accused Nos. 1 and 2. Thereafter, it was transferred to this
court, in pursuance of the order of the Hon'ble Chief Judicial Magistrate,
Thiruvananthapuram, the case was refiled as CC. 892/2015.

4. On appearance of the accused Nos.1 and 2, they were enlarged on bail on
04.05.2015. Thereafter accused No.2 went absconding and on 08.11.2019 case
against him was splited. Copies of all relevant prosecution records were
furnished to him under section 207 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. After
hearing prosecution and counsel for accused No. 1 charge framed for offences
ws. 341 and 324 read with Sec. 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860, read over and
explained to the accused No. 1, to which he pleaded not guilty and claimed to
be tried. Subsequently on 08.02.2024 accused No.2 appeared and bail taken.

5. On the side of prosecution, PW1 was examined and Exhibit P1 and MO1 were
marked. As the material witnesses failed to support the prosecution case, the
learned Assistant Public Prosecutor gave up the CW2 to CW7. In the absence
of any incriminating circumstances against the accused No. 1, questioning of
the accused No. 1, under section 313(1)(b) of Cr.P.C. was dispensed with.
Thereafter accused No. 1 was called upon to adduce evidence but no defence
evidence was adduced from the side of the accused No. 1.

4 of 6

6. Heard both sides and perused records.

7. The following points have arisen for determination:

(1) Whether, on 3.5.2015 at 22.30 hrs , at the western side of Attakulangara-
Pazhavangadi public road, in furtherance of their common intention of
accused Nos. 1 and 2, accused no.2 wrongfully restrained PW1 and thereby
committed an offence punishable u/s. 341 read with section 34 of Indian
Penal Code, 1860 ?

(2) Whether on the same day, at same time and place accused Nos. 1 and 2 in
furtherance of their common intention, accused no.1 hit on the left
shoulder ,left chest and back of head of PW1 with a helmet multiple times
and thereby accused Nos. 1 and 2 committed an offence punishable ws.
324 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 ?

(3) If the accused Nos. 1 and 2 are found guilty? What is the order as to
sentence?

8. Point Nos. 1 and 2 :-To avoid repetition and for brevity, point numbers 1 and
2 are considered together. Prosecution case is that accused Nos.1 and 2 have
committed offences punishable under sections 341 and 324 read with Sec. 34
of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

9. PW1 deposed that he was an auto rickshaw driver and admitted his signature
in the Ext P1 statement . According to him on 3.5.2015 ,he was asked to
remove his auto rickshaw by two persons and they took away its key .One
among them hit on his shoulder,chest and head with a helmet resulting in
pain .Being injured by the incident, he underwent treatment at General
Hospital, Thiruvananthapuram .He identified, the helmet, which was marked as

5 of 6
MO1. He further deposed that accused persons who were standing at the dock
never assaulted him and he has no grievance against them . It was also
deposed by him that he is not intending to proceed with the case.

10. The learned Assistant Public Prosecutor had given up other witnesses and he is
justified in doing so as the material witness did not support the case of
prosecution. Having considered evidence on record, this court is of the view
that prosecution has failed to prove the guilt of accused No. 1 for the said
reasons these points are found against the prosecution.

11. Point No.3 :- Upon the finding in point Nos. 1 and 2, accused No. 1 is found
not guilty of offences punishable under sections 341 and 324 read with Sec. 34
of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and he is acquitted of the said offences under
section 248(1) Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 . His bail bond stand
cancelled and he is set at liberty. Case against accused No.2 is split up and
refiled as CC. 971/2024.

The Helmet was produced before this court as T No. 187/2015 will be
destroyed after the appeal period is over according to law .
Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by her, corrected by me
and pronounced in the open court on this the 28" day of November, 2024.
Sd/-
Judicial First Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
